skill.name: sympy
skill.description: Use this skill when working with symbolic mathematics in Python. This skill should be used for symbolic computation tasks including solving equations algebraically, performing calculus operations (derivatives, integrals, limits), manipulating algebraic expressions, working with matrices symbolically, physics calculations, number theory problems, geometry computations, and generating executable code from mathematical expressions. Apply this skill when the user needs exact symbolic results rather than numerical approximations, or when working with mathematical formulas that contain variables and parameters.
skill.summary: Use this skill when working with symbolic mathematics in Python. This skill should be used for symbo...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: No data theft or malicious execution patterns were found in the skill content. The files contain documentation and example code only, with no network or filesystem access behavior.

content.value_statement: Solve symbolic math problems in Python when numeric answers are not enough. This skill guides you through exact algebra, calculus, and code generation with SymPy.
actual_capabilities: Compute derivatives, integrals, limits, and series
Perform matrix operations and eigen analysis
Work with physics mechanics and units
limitations: Requires SymPy installed in the runtime
Some equations have no closed form solution
Code generation for C or Fortran needs a compiler
Large numeric workloads need NumPy or SciPy for speed

use_cases.title: Check homework steps
use_cases.description: Verify algebra and calculus steps with exact symbolic results.

use_cases.title: Derive formulas
use_cases.description: Manipulate expressions and derive closed form results for papers.

use_cases.title: Model systems
use_cases.description: Build symbolic models and export code for numerical evaluation.

prompt_templates.title: Solve a quadratic
prompt_templates.prompt: Solve x**2 - 5*x + 6 = 0 symbolically and show the exact roots.

prompt_templates.title: Compute derivatives
prompt_templates.prompt: Differentiate sin(x**2) and simplify the result.

prompt_templates.title: Matrix analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Find eigenvalues and eigenvectors of [[1,2],[2,1]] and explain the steps.

prompt_templates.title: Generate code
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a NumPy function from x**2 + y**2 and explain how to evaluate it on arrays.

output_examples.input: Find the integral of x*exp(-x**2) from 0 to infinity and explain the result.
output: Identified the integrand as a standard Gaussian-related form
Noted that numeric evaluation matches the symbolic result

best_practices: Define symbols and assumptions before manipulating expressions
Use exact arithmetic with Rational or S instead of floats
Convert to lambdify for repeated numerical evaluation
anti_patterns: Using evalf in tight loops for large datasets
Skipping assumptions when simplification depends on sign or domain
Expecting a closed form solution for every equation

faq.question: Is this compatible with my Python version?
faq.answer: It works with standard Python and SymPy installs; use a supported SymPy version.

faq.question: What are the main limits?
faq.answer: Some problems have no closed form solution and require numerical methods.

faq.question: Can I integrate with NumPy or SciPy?
faq.answer: Yes, use lambdify to export expressions for NumPy or SciPy workflows.

faq.question: Does it access my files or keys?
faq.answer: No, the skill content is documentation and examples only.

faq.question: How do I fix slow performance?
faq.answer: Use lambdify or code generation instead of repeated subs and evalf.

faq.question: How does it compare to numeric solvers?
faq.answer: It focuses on exact symbolic results, while numeric solvers return approximations.
